name: contrition
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a very sorry or guilty feeling about something bad you have done, or the act of showing that you feel like this: He feels no contrition for what he did. Those involved in the crime have failed to express contrition. See
contrite
More examplesFewer examplesIf a defendant shows contrition and accepts responsibility, he is more likely to avoid prison. I have communicated my contrition and remorse to the young man and his family.He's got to demonstrate genuine contrition for the misjudgements he made.
